Reviews.Title: “disappointed”
Reviews.Author: John R Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: the room as a double but very small. The decoration was very shabby , looked like it hadnt been done for years, very old and worn. The tv ancient, very small , so dated it had a video slot. There were no shower gels or shampoo , only hard soap.. The breakfast consisted of orange juice , tea and two rounds of toast. Wont be staying there again

Reviews.Title: “Decent Budget Hotel”
Reviews.Author: GarethEdwards1977
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for luxury accomodation, then try The Savoy up the road for Â£500 a night. However if you just want a nice clean warm room then The Lancater Court Hotel is fine. The sheets and bed were clean, I got a little cosy room on the top floor with a clean bed and clean sheets, a sink and a shower cubicle in the room which was a bonus as I'd not expected any en-suite facilities. I stayed on a cold February night and was glad of a nice warm place to sleep for a bargain price The location is excellent, just 5 mins walk from the tube with a short journey to the west-end and very close to Hyde Park. Staff were friendly, professional and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for.”
Reviews.Author: Artcrawl
Reviews.Content: This is ok if you are on a budget. The room we had faced the road and was 4 floors up. There was a lot of road noise (we slept with ear plugs - makes waking for an alarm difficult though). Obviously last occupant smoked but did so in the toilet so as not to set off the fire alarm and the place smelled like an ash tray for the first 4-5 days or so ( there approx a week). "Full breakfast" means - toast... that's it... toast down in the lobby standing around in front of the reception desk. Never saw anyone eat it myself! Don't think anyone bothered. If you are older a real issue is the following....- think - no elevator, 4 floors up, winding tiny stair case and 23kg suitcases! If you haven't been to the gym in over a couple of months- forget it! They're not going to help you with the bags and getting them up to the room is a full on work out! Then when you get them there, you better be ready to sleep on top of them because they're not going to be going anywhere else (unless you want to store them in the shower cubical over night-) because we're not talking a lot of room ( just kidding, kinda. We did fit them in the room but you can't open the toilet door fully when you do). The reception staff were ok'ish. Initially cold but at times smiled.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location and Value for Money.”
Reviews.Author: johnLFC23
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel twice in just over a week. I'm not usually a 'trip advisor' but having read some of the awful and unjust reviews of this hotel, I felt compelled to 'voice' my opinion. My first trip was a last minute thing where I woke up ad decided to go to London! Having already booked with the hotel for my planned visit 10 days later I contacted the hotel to see what they could do for me for that night. The staff were very helpful and offered me a single room with shower for Â£40. I was very pleased to find a room but also at the rate I was charged. My second trip last night, was to watch the Chelsea v LFC Carling Cup Tie, on this occasion I paid Â£30 for a single room with shower. The beds were very comfortable on both occasions, clean, fluffy white towels were provided, and the rooms were both clean. The location of this place is perfect, your right on the edge of Hyde park, between Paddington and Lancaster Gate Tube Stations - you literally have access to all the tourist sites you could want to visit; and easy access to Stamford Bridge (Fulham Broadway Stn) which was important on my second visit. The hotel offer a continental breakfast with every stay - as I am not an early riser I chose not to take breakfast in favour of an extra hour in bed! Another bonus I found was the check out time of 11.00am, in many other London hotels I have stayed I have rarely had a check out time later than 10.00am. Of all the reviews I have read there arent many that I have found to be a fair reflection, which is dissapointing, as that tells me this site is being abused, to the detriment of hoteliers and also the consumer. If you are looking for a high end establishment, then open your purses and wallets a bit wider and go around the corner to the hilton. However, if you are like me and want somewhere clean, with a bed and a shower, thats in close proximity to attractions and is affordable for your average working class kinda guy (or gal!) this is the place for you! But please dont book here if you have expectations of valet parking, concierge, bell boys, lifts to all floors, champagne receptions etc as you will be dissapointed, though the price point should give you a big clue that these frills won't be provided. In summary, the Lancaster Court Hotel, offers affordable, no frills, accomodation in the centre of one of the most amazing cities in the world. Budget travellers this is definately a place to check out. Please, no more silly reviews...they are very misleading. Thanks for two great stays. A little gem

Reviews.Title: “Do not book into Room 11!”
Reviews.Author: Elle B
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend booked this hotel for us last week. Ok yes, it's a budget hotel and no we certainly weren't expecting the Ritz; however the room we were given was horrendous. Just behind reception is Room 11, with a (not so) sliding door to the shower room and a toilet that churns waste each time the light is turned on; disappointed is definitely an understatement. I could have dealt with the noise had it not been accompanied by the stench of the churning toilet. The carpet was dirty and torn and the bed creaked with every breath. When we asked to change rooms, of course every room was 'fully booked'. The photo's this hotel uses to advertise are indeed misleading - I would pay attention to the tourist photo's as they are more accurate. Thankfully, we'll never be staying here again, there are far superior places to stay in London at the same price and cheaper. Unfortunately, that's the risk you take when booking hotels in this area.

Reviews.Title: “Everything I expected!”
Reviews.Author: loulop
Reviews.Content: Let me start by first saying that this hotel is NOT expensive, posh or a place your would stay with the intention of spending all your holiday in. Â£50/night....that's a place to get some sleep, shower, a quick breakfast and then get OUT to enjoy London, while leaving your stuff in a place you know it won't get nicked. I don't understand what all of these travellers complaining about basic breakfasts and tv sizes think they're going to get for Â£50/night in LONDON. Try the Hilton round the corner if you want waited on hand and foot. Cheapskates. This place was clean, quiet and had comfy beds. There were several changes I had to make during my stay - room changes and whatever - just because of circumstance and friends deciding to extend their visit to London, and the staff (esp. Mustafa!) couldn't have been more helpful and lovely. I had a few valuables on me which i didn't feel comfortable leaving out, albeit in a locked hotel room, and so they locked it away in the reception safe for me. They were so helpful, in fact, that I felt the chocolates I left for them when I checked out were the least i could do. Just a great place. Bottom line: yeah, you have to carry your own bags. Wtf are you used to? This big thing about the showers being in the hotel room....I knew this before i booked because I actually read the room description before punching in my credit card details. Who doesn't? But if you're coming to London to actually DO things other than criticise the thread count of your duvet covers; this is the hotel for you. I will be returning to this little hidden gem.

Reviews.Title: “need to ask for room22”
Reviews.Author: Tim621
Reviews.Content: New updated room with brand new fittings, hotel is old, but very friendly, other rooms are probably not so good, but this one was excellent value for money and completely refurbished

Reviews.Title: “Very basic but affordable!”
Reviews.Author: 1879fulham
Reviews.Content: Frequently stay at this hotel when I stay in London on a net account basis. If you are prepared to compromise a little on space and comfort then this hotel is ok. Good central location it is what it is!

Reviews.Title: “Lancaster Court Hotel”
Reviews.Author: danish4
Reviews.Content: I had booked a room with toilet & shower, but at the arrival the reception manager told me that I had booked a room without such "conveniences". Showing my booking papers persuaded the manager to provide a room with an iron shower cabin. I climbed up the narrow loft stairs, passed a closed fire door and went into a small and worn-out attic room, the kind of room that you see in TV series like Foyle's War and Sherlock Holmes. The water in the shower cabin was cold, the lamp over the wash was out of order but the worst thing was the leaky window. The room was so cold, dark and depressing that I just used it for sleeping, roaming the streets during the daytime. In the night in order to block the wind from blowing in I had to press the curtains against the windows using a drinking glass, a waterbottle, an electrical toothbrush and a shirt. Then I unhooked the bath curtain and used it as an extra insulating by hooking it to the real curtains and pressing the lowest part of the bath curtain to the wall by using the bed. Needles to say the hotel is not suitable for staying in during the winter time, nor would I recommend it for elderly people or families with children. Come to think about it I would not recommend the Lancaster Court Hotel at all

Reviews.Title: “Only 1 point for location”
Reviews.Author: Susy2608
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very well situated but forget about the breakfast or rooms. We had a room next to the breakfast room and it was extremely loud from 7am. Our room was in the basement however we had a door in the room which let the light from the street lamps come in (the whole night). The hotel seems to be very old and unfortunately not really well kept. It looks very nice from out site but inside needs an improvement. Forget about waking up late, cleaners start at 8am and are quite loud. Breakfast is just toast, croissant, coffee or black tea, butter and jam. We met my cousin in London and she stayed at a hostel which was better than this hotel and also cheaper. I will not recommend this hotel to anyone who wants to enjoy London during the day and have a good rest in the night.

Reviews.Title: “Basic hotel with good connections”
Reviews.Author: wille_w
Reviews.Content: Lancaster Court Hotel is nicely located between Paddington Railway Station + Underground Station and Lancaster Gate Underground Station. My room w/ shower and sink was small but OK to have a bed to sleep in. It was in the 3rd floor, window facing to the street (Sussex Gardens), which was quite busy but with earplugs I had no trouble sleeping. The shower in the room was a bit awkward and the water pressure low in the hose, toilet in the corridor was always free when I needed it. Old-fashioned TV worked tho some channels were of poor quality but I got a hang of the news which was nice. The breakfast room was a bit tiny and crowded at times but service was swift and friendly. The breakfast itself was very basic but sufficient at least for me. The staff at the reception were friendly as well. There is wi-fi available for pound or two per hour and a public PC to be utilized. My opinion is that wi-fi should be free of charge for guests these days and find it lack of quality in service. There is a luggage room available. It gave a safe impression to notice that the hotel front door is locked at all times. I stayed in the beginning of June and the surroundings were green and looked like spacious. You can easily connect to the city by bus or underground. If you're not looking for luxury but settle for a basic place to sleep then I could recommend this one for you.

Reviews.Title: “Worse Hotel i have every stayed in”
Reviews.Author: kerrysuzanne
Reviews.Content: Dont waste your money, room 32 was discusting, toilet has a sliding door to seperate you from the bedroom which did not close, shower no more basic than a caravan shower and it was luke warm, toilet was like a chemical one which smelt so bad we had to keep the window open (which had to be wedged open with my trainers to stop it closing) Bed side lamps did not work, staff VERY RUDE and unhelpful with a 'i dont care' attitude who did not help me at all. Give me a travel lodge anytime

Reviews.Title: “We hated it”
Reviews.Author: Alex W
Reviews.Content: We arrived to the hotel and the staff were nice but that was as good as it got after 5 flytes of stares we entered the room it was of poor decorative order but clean ish there was no tea or coffee making facility's in the room the hole place was shabby not worth the Â£138.00 for the two nights the pics on the web site where miss leading at best DONT BOOK THIS HOTEL

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel I ve seen in the last 20 years”
Reviews.Author: Jochen S
Reviews.Content: This place is completely run down, dirty and just disgusting. Given these facts it is way too expensive. Every hostel is better. I had a 30 minutes shooting match with the receptionist, changed rooms and was moved to an equally terrible room. This place is far from being even poor. I cant recommend this place anybody, even though the location is great. Fortunately I stayed only one night, but this was the only "hotel" I ever stayed in where I feared that the receptionist would throw out my stuff while I was out for dining (which didnt happen tough)...

Reviews.Title: “Bit basic but great location”
Reviews.Author: dsp2011
Reviews.Content: Thoroughly enjoyed my stay but put it down to ease of tube links and how I spent my time in the capital. Having only been to the capital once before and stubbornly sticking to travelodge everytime I go anywhere. Wanted to try somewhere different in a nice area. Short walk to Hyde Park, fantastic, free continental breakfast - a round of toast in the basement. as I've said pluses and negatives. My biggest gripe. Travelling with a good friend I booked a twin, allocated the room above reception - had a great little balcony on top of the main entrance porch. Website was totally unclear about the facilities, shared toilet down a set if stairs, can understand other reviews which say you just hear people running up and down stairs all the time banging on doors. You have to. Shower facilities in the room, not what I imagined, whilst myself and my travelling partner are close we were not close enough to share a bed, let alone enough to shower in front of each other and shower cubicle at one end of the room with no privacy screen/curtain proved awkward, hence I was grateful for the balcony, we could both escape giving one another privacy. Glad it didn't rain! I would have thought this would go without saying in a TWIN. Think a room or two should be sacrificed and a few en-suites put in. Don't think it would affect the revenue. It has potential. But I won't return.

Reviews.Title: “Don't waste your money”
Reviews.Author: Madeleine5703
Reviews.Content: Terrible hotel- in very rough shape. Bare minimum of accommodation for mid-range price. The reason they make you pay up front is that most people would cancel their stay once they see their room !!! Rooms have bed, tv (that doesn't ever work anyway) and a stand up shower-that had lots of black mold. We had prepaid for 5 nights(big mistake). It was very hit and miss as to whether or not you had enough towels or even a bar of soap for your morning shower. Staff was not accommodating-pretended their English was poor so that they didn't have to respond to your questions or complaints. Breakfast was a total ripoff-dry toast and a cup of tea/coffee and prepackaged croissants. The only positive was its location-close to Paddington Station which made it convenient to get to the tourist attractions in London. Be very careful before you book this hotel-as I am sure you will be very dissappointed!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Don't waste your time and money!”
Reviews.Author: asear1
Reviews.Content: Staff were rude and most unhelpful, rooms are small and run-down, facilities are poor and the price is outrageous for what I got. Only thing going for it is the location. You can definitely do better!

Reviews.Title: “Old crappy and in need of a big refurb”
Reviews.Author: tororosso125
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with work as they've tightened their purse strings previously staying in 4 star hotels. I will not be recommending it to any of my colleagues. I was on the 5th floor for 5 nights and was firstly shocked having to pay on arrival in full then having to hand my key in every time i left the hotel! I had no evidence it was my key when i came back! Shows they dont trust their customers. The breakfast is poor not even any cereal on show just 4 pieces of toast and a croissant in a bag. The shower is in the corner of the room and took 15 mintes to warm up and i only just fit on the toilet if i sat sideways! There is a tv in the room but no free view only terrestrial with terrible signal and its only a 10 inch screen maximum! It is a budget hotel but at the price i paid the travel lodge is 100 times better.

Reviews.Title: “It was not a good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: dinahkGeelong
Reviews.Content: When we arrived, there was no help with our suitcases which we lugged ourselves down several stairs. No tea and coffee making facilities, our outlook was onto a ladder outside and not much else. The ensuite was not so much attached but actually in the room - no privacy! We won't mention the noisy toilet and there were hairs in out bed. The breakfast was okay.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay there!”
Reviews.Author: RichardSPBR
Reviews.Content: Unfriendly staff, shower didn't work and was sent to public shower (which looked like a gas chamber), worn-out furniture, seems totally abandoned by owner. Was told there was wifi, complained to reception and they said it was the internet company's fault that it wasn't working. Go to any other hotel in London if you don't want to get upset.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT BOOK FOR FRIDAY/SATURDAY!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Euzhemur
Reviews.Content: Do not do not do not do not do not do not DO NOT book for a Friday or Saturday! Place turns into a PARTY HOTEL at the weekends: gangs of teenage foreign travellers leap from room to room yelling at each other until 5 in the morning. Pretty horrific as the walls and stairs are paper-thin. Hordes of these youngsters come stumbling back drunk throughout the night. You won't get a wink of sleep. I went down to reception to complain and they said: "Just knock on their door and scare them." I was utterly shocked by this. DIsgraceful service. Then the weekend passed and I had a lovely, quiet stay. Strange.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: shahzadyusuf
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 5 nights from 5th December & found this hotel to be very centrally located. All the important shopping & tourist places is close by & London's main railway station at Paddington is just 3-4 mts walk away. But unfortunately, this is the only positive point about this hotel. Quality of room was very ordinary & so was cleanliness. No attached toilet was another big drawback.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap - nothing else”
Reviews.Author: Pilats
Reviews.Content: Good Location, One roof, One Bed! 3 x 2 Square metre room! No shower inside and outside the room! Awful Breakfast! Old Painting, Old furniture, Old Doors, generally everything was old and didn't work well! To avoid if you travel with family or girlfriend! To stay only if you need a cheap place to sleep!

Reviews.Title: “worst hotel I've ever stayed in my entire life...”
Reviews.Author: ozgek
Reviews.Content: I'v enever stayed in a hotel like this before. Even it was not so cheapi I paid 80Â£ for 1 night. They give me a room in 4th floor, as there were no elevator I carried my luggue to 4th floor. The room was terrible, I can not even describe. I asked water from the reception they told me to go the the supermarket or drink tab water where there were no glass. Don't ever go this hotel, hostels are better. I didn't sleep whole night

Reviews.Title: “failure in all counts! paying for location only.”
Reviews.Author: Cl2aZy
Reviews.Content: Chose this hotel because of it's cheap price and location. But was horribly shocked at the absolutely lack of service and attitude of the service staff. Room was decently clean, sheets and toilets was clean. Was given a room with a cellar as a toilet. It was cold without heaters in the toilet. The power sockets in the room wouldn't work (no power). My nightmare came, when they gave us the wrong key to the room. I'd figured that we didn't notice this until the next morning because the first time we entered the room it wasn't locked, so we didn't know we took the wrong key till tomorrow morning. We went to the dinning hall for breakfast, naturally we locked the room. After breakfast, we tried to unlock the door, but was not able to. The staff was very nonchalant, was not very keen to help us even after we told him we had a tour to catch. Attitude was horrible, no apologies, instead accusing us of spoiling the lock, and if we did anything funny to it. He tried to open the room with the master key, but to no avail. After which he took his time to call his mechanic down. Upon arrival of the mechanic, he came to the door with another set of keys and opened it in a flash, before inspecting the lock. The mechanic, told us that it was not our fault. It was the wrong key given to us. I confronted the front desk staff, and he just said, it was not his fault blatantly. I retorted that his very own mechanic said it was his fault, and he immediately changed his statement saying that it was an experience. We eventually had to take a taxi down to catch the local tour, incurring much stress and cost to us. Will never ever go back to this hotel(motel). Please do NOT visit it. DL;DR: Service attitude is atrocious, rooms are small but clean.

Reviews.Title: “very poor value for money”
Reviews.Author: buzzd2000
Reviews.Content: unfriendly! service a smile cost nothing, broken glass and dampness on wall in hallway, room was tiny with paper hanging of cieling, filthy carpet. (bed linnen was clean) over priced but hey its London. Breackfast consisted of diluted orange (no choice) coffee or tea and toast white no choice) dont wait for anything else to eat its not comming!!! worst place ive stayed in maney years.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely discusting”
Reviews.Author: dansker53
Reviews.Content: Do not be taken in by the pictures on the internet. This is a low rate Bed and Breakfast place. Lots of narrow stairs. I was in an atic room on 4th floor. the website indicates that it is respectable. It is full of elegant pictures. do not be fooled. The room was absolutely discusting. I should have stayed 2 nights but only stayed 1 night. Staff on reception far from helpful. There is no manager on the premisses and the staff say that they have no authority to solve problems Breakfast is the meanest I have ever experience and the staff indifferent to your needs.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel from Hell!”
Reviews.Author: AngieH22
Reviews.Content: The only good thing I can say about this hotel is that the location was excellent. It is a stones throw from Hyde Park and we managed to pre-book a parking space. Other than that it was awful and I'm glad that we only stayed 1 night. We had booked a double ensuite room. What we got was a double room in the basement with a shower cubicle in the corner of the room and the sink and toilet in what can only be described as a cupboard. The room was in desperate need of decorating, the windows didn't lock properly so don't recommend leaving anything valuable in the room if you go out. There was no tea/coffee tray in the room (good job we took our own) and in the morning couldn't even have a shower because there was no hotel water! Forgot to mention that the bed was like sleeping on a concrete slab! For what we paid we could have booked a Travelodge which I know would have been 10 times better. Would not recommend this hotel to my worst enemy let alone my friends!

Reviews.Title: “Overrated, even for London”
Reviews.Author: jesseliz
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel, were greeted frostily, told rather sharply that we MUST pay on arrival and given a key for a top floor room. We carried our exremely heavy packs up four flights of stairs only to find the room we had been given was already occupied - rather embarrasing. I went all the way back down the stairs only to be given a room on the top floor at the other end of the building, so I had to walk all the way back up to get the bags, all the way back down and back up to the top floor. So we weren't in the best frame of mind when we arrived in a room that was tiny, with a shower in the corner of the room, no toilet, a tiny, old bed that sloped horribly to one side and a very small sink. Decor is old, but not in a charming way. We also had to leave our key at reception when we went out, which I found a little strange - especially when they seem to hand out wrong keys. Every time we walked past reception there was someone complaining, the internet was expensive and for the price, i felt this was way below par. Wish we had stayed somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, fine place to sleep”
Reviews.Author: XansMama
Reviews.Content: The staff was very helpful and friendly! Based on the pictures I expected a nice Victorian style hotel. While it was basically in that kind of style, it was not as nice as the pictures showed and it was in a bit of a state of disrepair. The furnishings in the room were old and very basic. It was very difficult to find an outlet - we finally located one under the little desk. As another reviewer put it, the bathroom was basically shoe-horned into a closet, but at least we had a toilet, sink and shower in our room. The location was excellent - just a few minutes walk to Paddington station and Hyde Park; bus stops were also not a far walk. The hotel had a locked luggage room, so we were able to store our suitcases until later that night since our room wasn't ready when we checked in. This allowed us to go ahead and tour and take advantage of part of our first day in London - precious time for us that we couldn't afford to lose. Breakfast was very basic but we were glad not to have to locate a place to eat and spend the extra money - it included tea and coffee, milk and juice upon request, toast, croissants, jellies, and small packaged cheeses. For the price, excellent location and friendly staff this hotel is fine.

Reviews.Title: “just a few improvements”
Reviews.Author: Gizmo_kitkat
Reviews.Content: Great location, right beside Lancaster gate tube station, and handy for walks into Hyde park. The outside looks a little bit shabby, but that doesn't matter. Staff are fantastic. The staff on the desk where more than helpful in giving directions. We went for the "superior" room for the en-suite. small room, and a bathroom shoehorned into a cupboard, but still fine. No tea and coffee in the room, but then again, no where to put it! Breakfast was fine, tea or coffee with as much toast and you could eat. Found out that a cooked breakfast is available, but you have to let the kitchen know in advance. We where at the front of the hotel, but the noise wasn't too bad. Perhaps this is because we are both form another big city and night time noise doesn't bother us... All in all, rooms could be bigger, and some tea and coffee in the room would be nice, but hey, who cares really!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money in Central London”
Reviews.Author: goldengirlathome
Reviews.Content: I was a bit worried by some of the previous reviews and arrived with some apprehension. i need not have worried. We received a warm welcome at the desk and found our room to be recently decorated and with spotless sheets and a very nice shower room. This is all you need if you are going to be out all day. There are a couple of nice pubs nearby where the meals were good. It is very close to the tube station and the Italian Garden in Hyde Park. All in all a very enjoyable trip. Maybe it depends which room you get. We were at the back and it was very quiet.

Reviews.Title: “DONT USE THIS HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: GlynNGaz
Reviews.Content: This hotel states that you have a room with ashower. What it fails to do is tell you that tit doesn't come with a toilet, so unless you like to do your business in the shower I would suggest you book elsewhere. Also look at the small print very carefully. Regardless of the fact that I let the hotel know in good time that I was marooned abroad, which included several phone calls from Portugal, they would not allow me to change the date of my booking. So Â£40 lost down the toilet - if it had one that is

Reviews.Title: “Location is about the only good thing”
Reviews.Author: Milereb
Reviews.Content: Aside from that the location is close to two tube stations that get you about anywhere in London is really about the only good thing here. The beds were so hard sleeping on the floor was better. Toilet and shower where shoved in a tiny little closet with a sad excuse for a door. Everytime someone flushed on the floor awefull stench came out of our 'bathroom'. Even more horrible is that the window was broken and therefore refused to stay open. Walls were so thin sleeping was pretty much impossible if neighbours decided to watch telly at night. Breakfast was horrid, if one wants a proper one, do eat outside of the hotel. Best part of it all was when we came in the second night, the person behind the register was more then happy to charge us a second time for our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Bother”
Reviews.Author: greasedweasel
Reviews.Content: Where do I start, creaky bed, creaky wardrobe, creaky floor, creaky shower door and Mouldy ceiling's. No coffee and tea facilities in the room but you could order at a cost of Â£3.50 for 2 cups. No iron or hairdryer in room but could be hired from reception. Continental Breakfast was orange juice, coffee or tea and cheap bread partially toasted. Room was cold, small and poorly decorated and I really wish I had not stayed there at all. There was door slamming all night, well pretty much the whole time we were there.

Reviews.Title: “value for central london”
Reviews.Author: aidanheffo
Reviews.Content: i found it clean and tidy. I had room No 1, so I didn't have far to go! A single room suited me. Not very expensive. Good value considering it was in the heart of London. Staff were polite but a little "distant." Would go there again. Aidan Heffernan

Reviews.Title: “You can do much better !”
Reviews.Author: esjac
Reviews.Content: I spent a long time looking for accomodation and did not have a lot of money to spend. I picked Paddington because it was central and I could catch the Heathrow express straight there. Firstly, I would not stay in paddington at all !! It is way too full of tourists and not a nice area. I stayed at this hotel for a week while I looked for somewhere to live. We were underground which was terrible !!! It was dark and awful. If you stay here make sure you dont get a room underground. The room was tiny, the bathroom so so small and the tv did not work. I thought it was way too much for what it was. You can definitely do much much better.

HotelInfo.Name: Lancaster Court Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 202-204 Sussex Gardens, London W2 3UA, England
